entry.title: Moonlight Desires
entry.summary:
Author: SomebodyIUsetoKnow

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,521Chapters: 1/6Kudos: 10

Summary: Forced to take his accumulated PTO (paid time off) from the past year, Dick is venturing out of Gotham for a vacation. Gifted the use of one of the Wayne's many vacation properties, an isolated house on the coast of North Carolina, Dick plans to enjoy a few days of sun, surf and quiet on his own before Jason joins him.It seems, however, that his luck from last year hasn't gotten any better.

entry.title: You Are Out of My League
entry.summary:
Author: ivebeenbamboozled (brainwitchletty)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 442,245Chapters: 42/?Kudos: 1,123

Summary: The story begins with a new Robin to replace the old, with Nightwing none the wiser to being replaced at all, and suddenly he has a little brother within the same terrible day. It takes a while to accept, but Dick quickly learns this new Robin-- Jason Todd-- is exactly what Dick Grayson was always missing in his life, and in many more ways than one. Through the years with the team and working with the Justice League, Jason finds a place for himself and becomes a vital member of the Young Justice League while also becoming a vital centerpiece in Dick's life. And when all that ends-- when Jason Todd is taken away from Dick-- it's going to be even harder to put his life back together with that emptiness returning once more.. . .Mostly canon compliant story detailing Jason's introduction to the Young Justice League as Robin, his eventual death, and Dick discovering the mysterious red-hooded figure acting as Ra's Al Ghul's bodyguard is a lot more familiar than he should be.

entry.title: Transference
entry.summary:
Author: murphy_stoffelis

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,187Chapters: 3/16Kudos: 29

Summary: A violent blight is sweeping through Gotham. Innocent people are suddenly being consumed by rage— with disastrous consequences. With no cure in sight, Jason finds himself working with Batman to save the city from madness.Even with his resurrection a thing of the past, an alliance with the Bats is a harrowing line between reconnecting with a former life and preserving the Red Hood's hard-won autonomy— especially when Jason's partnership with Dick Grayson begins to rekindle a past they've both tried to bury.Because in a city like Gotham, you can't trust who you love. Not even family.

entry.title: Do You Got Room For One More Troubled Soul?
entry.summary:
Author: KuroNekoFe

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,889Chapters: 4/15Kudos: 37

Summary: In which Jason and Dick became best friends and fell in love before Bruce took Jason in and when Dick was still Robin. But that doesn't mean that love is ever easy. Dick sighs and shakes his head, exasperated. “So who is he?” he asks. “Some newly orphaned kid, like I was?” “His name is Jason Todd,” Bruce tells him. Dizzying awe abruptly replaces Dick's irritability. A spark of hope lights up his chest. His voice is barely above a whisper as he asks, “Jason?”

entry.title: Break the Wing, Mend the Man
entry.summary:
Author: Deadnite

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,875Chapters: 6/50Kudos: 17

Summary: Blüdhaven is gone.Dick Grayson barely made it out alive.After a brutal fight with Blockbuster leaves the city in ruins, Dick is left broken—physically, mentally, emotionally. But what happened in the rubble was worse than any battle he's ever faced. When Catalina Flores takes everything from him, Dick returns to Gotham not as a hero, but as a shadow of the boy who once believed he could save everyone.He can't sleep. He can't speak. He can't stop bleeding.Recovery isn't heroic.It's slow. It's cruel.And it drags every member of the Batfamily down with him.This is the story of what comes after the fall:The rage.The silence.The scars no one sees.And the people who refuse to let him go under—even when he begs them to.A story of trauma, survival, and the long, ugly road to healing.

entry.summary:
Author: SuddenlySullen

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,312Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 75

Summary: “I know that look,” a familiar voice says over Jason's shoulder. When he turns, he's standing face-to-face with Dick Grayson.“What look is that?” Jason squares his shoulders and tries to convince himself there's no way in hell Dick will recognize him, from this life or the last.“The look of someone here because he has to be, not because he wants to be. It's easier to hide it if you get in there and find someone to talk to. And look at that, you already found someone to talk to!” Dick flashes a bright smile, trying to bait Jason into following him into the venue.

entry.title: Winter in Gotham.
entry.summary:
Author: TenderKindOfRuin

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,399Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 109

Summary: Dick Grayson hasn't seen Jason Todd for four months. Learning the hard way, Dick can vouch that absence does certainly make the heart grow stronger. A slow burning flame still flickers between the two, yet every time Jason and Dick seem to be getting somewhere good; something never fails to happen to make Jason run off. This time, determined not to let Jason slip away again, Dick is pleasantly surprised to run into the very man himself when least expected. Unable to let old feelings rest, the pair share a kiss. Realising just how miserable they are without the other one around, their kiss has the possibility to ignite a much stronger flame bound to lead to much more than just a kiss being shared.

entry.title: performing, or living
entry.summary:
Author: chasm_side

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 42,427Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 183

Summary: "Everyone tells themselves little stories about who they are," she told him. "Stories about why they do what they do, why they want what they want. And that's fine—telling a story isn't the same as telling a lie, you know?" "Sure," Dick agreed. "It only gets fucked up when you start thinking your story is the only story worth believing," Jay said. "That you've got some kind of monopoly on truth, that you're the only person who gets to tell other people what's really real. So… if you let me have my little stories, I'll let you have yours. If you need to believe in Batman, if you need Bruce to be a good father, if you need to roll around in your shame about not being honest with Daddy about all the awesome sex you're having with the most problematic of Daddy's problem children—I mean, sure, whatever gets you off, right?" Dick Grayson navigates the line between fantasy and reality, tries to be a better man, has increasingly kinky sex with his pseudo-sister, and refuses to have a crisis about any of it. Jay's taking everything in stride, so why shouldn't Dick learn to accept a little volatility in his civilian life? It's only as Nightwing that he has to care about control.
